metadata.title: CVE-2015-8368 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
ntopng (aka ntop) before 2.2 allows remote authenticated users to changethe login context and gain privileges via the user cookie and usernameparameter to admin/password_reset.lua.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8368` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ntopng - 2.2+dfsg1-1build1
ntopng-data - 2.2+dfsg1-1build1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ntopng package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.2+dfsg1-1build1').
